author: gdamour
msg: o Gets rid of the weight-based NodeTopology;
o Replaces it with a simple interface, NodeTopology, defining the basic contracts of a node topology;
o Introduces the Cluster notion: a Cluster seats on top of a cluster of nodes. The topology of these
latter is managed automatically by Cluster. More acccurately, Cluster delegates to TopologyManager
the computing of the new topology when a Node joins or leaves it;
o Introduces the notion of TopologyManager: it allows to implement various Node topologies (e.g. ring,
mesh,hypercube);
o Implements a simple ring topology;
o Node does not offer anymore the ability to join or leave a remote Node. Instead, when its topology
is set, it leaves and/or joins remote nodes based on the neighbours defined by NodeTopology and the
currently connected neighbours; It then cascades the new topology to all of its neighbours.
o EndPoints are no more required to be GBeans. StreamManager, EndPointProxyFactory and
ReferenceableManager are now basic EndPoints (no more GBeans). Their implementations can be replaced
via standard inheritence of NodeImpl; and
o Renames GBean to GBeanLifecycle.
